definitions.definition: To make a record of information.
definitions.example: I wanted to record every detail of what happened, for the benefit of future generations.

definitions.definition: To make an audio or video recording of.
definitions.example: Within a week they had recorded both the song and the video for it.

definitions.definition: To give legal status to by making an official public record.
definitions.example: When the deed was recorded, we officially owned the house.

definitions.definition: To fix in a medium, usually in a tangible medium.
To make an audio, video, or multimedia recording.
To sing or repeat a tune.
That has been fixed into a physical medium (for example, a book, compact disc or videotape).
definitions.example: Recorded music comes in many forms.
